纳米勒是一只长老龙，具有鳐鱼、深海鱼和水母的特征。它巨大的翅膀上面是黑色的，下面是浅蓝色的，有彩虹般的发光，不断地跳动。它的头部是红色和蓝色的，有同样的脉冲发光，但当它的水被抽干后，它的身体和翅膀的底部都有一种乳白色的褐色。它的下颚也有多根长须。
与大多数长老龙一样，大多数怪物只要一出现就会逃走。它宣称自己是食物链的顶端。然而，它消费的是什么，是一个谜。根据它的针状牙齿结构，可以推测它是以鱼为食的，也可能是以鱼腥草为食的翼龙。只有其他长老龙和最近发现的{@creature Savage Deviljho|MHMM}，其中的蛮牛狼人能够与它的力量相当，似乎愿意挑战它。
纳米勒是一只非常独特的长老龙，它的身体带有海洋中发现的各种生物的影子。它的翅膀类似于鳐鱼的翅膀，而翅膀的尖端可以像电鳗一样放电。它的翅膀的薄膜和脸部的一部分会发出生物发光的光，并随着彩虹颜色的变化而跳动，它有像深海鱼一样的大针状牙齿。它的翅膀上还有像梳子水母一样的梳子，使其进一步发出生物荧光。然而，它最引人注目的特点是它能够生产、控制和吸收水。
然而，所说的水似乎并不是纯水，而是它内部的唾液和水混合在一起，形成一种粘液状的水，可以粘附并长时间保持湿润。这种水从它的嘴里射出，可以自由地吸收回去，只要它挥动一下翅膀或前爪，就可以使站在这种水上的猎人随意地来回滑动。它还可以将这种水射向地面，导致潮水涌起。更有趣的是，Namielle实际上可以产生电力，并利用闪电使它的水拍通电，然后猛烈地爆炸成蒸汽。
Namielle相当独特的地方是，它即使勉强拍打翅膀也能飞行，并像鳐鱼在水中那样在空中滑行。纳米勒还似乎有能力用它的身体遮住太阳，从而造成瞬间的黑暗。然而，应该注意的是，这种能力只是在最初发现它时表现出来。

items.name: Namielle Finehide
entries: {@i Tool Specialist.}当穿着这件盔甲时，你的熟练度加成是双倍的，用于你精通的工具的任何能力检查。

items.name: Namielle Hardclaw
entries: {@i Blightproof.} 穿着这件盔甲时，你对枯萎法术、类似法术的能力和条件免疫。

items.name: Namielle Whisker
entries: {@i Constitution.}当你穿上这件盔甲时，来自减速效果的持续时间，如{@spell slow}咒语或铜龙的呼吸攻击，会减少一半。

items.name: Namielle Fellwing
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+2.}穿戴此盔甲时，你可以使用行动从它身上施放{@spell haste}的咒语，每天一次，但施放时只能以自己为目标，咒语结束时你会获得1级的{@condition exhaustion}。

items.name: Namielle Lash
entries: While wearing this armor you have resistances to lightning damage.

items.name: Namielle Mantle
entries: While wearing this armor you have immunity to cold damage.

items.name: Namielle Finehide
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell levitate} spell on yourself at will.

items.name: Namielle Hardclaw
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell dancing lights} spell at will.

items.name: Namielle Whisker
entries: 当你用此武器重伤时，目标在下一回合开始前不能做出反应。

items.name: Namielle Fellwing
entries: When you finish a short or long rest you choose a damage type. This damage type can be either cold or lightning damage. A creature hit by this weapon takes an extra 1d8 of the chosen damage type.

items.name: Namielle Lash
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} This weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell shape water|XGE} (1 rune), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 rune), {@spell fog cloud} (1 rune), {@spell call lightning} (3 runes) or {@spell control water} (4 runes). The weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Namielle Mantle
entries: You gain a + 1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 when the spell you are casting deals cold or lightning damage.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: 任何稀有的武器升级材料。

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: 任何稀有的装甲升级材料。

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or Darkness, the Nargacuga can take the {@action Hide} action as a Bonus Action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +11.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nargacuga makes three attacks. one with its bite, one with its bladed wings, and one with its tail swipe. Or it makes two tail spike attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bladed Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail Spikes
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Feral Pounce (recharge 5-6).
entries: The Nargacuga leaps towards its target, jumping 10 feet, as part of its movement, and attacks with both its claws. The target must succeed a {@dc 18} Dex saving throw or take 44 ({@dice 8d10}) damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success the target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. Additionally, if the target is {@condition prone} or knocked {@condition prone}, the nargacuga can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

它有黑色的鳞片、黑色的皮毛和梦魇般的红色眼睛，使它具有掠夺性黑豹的外观和风格。它黑暗、野性的外表表明，它可能主要是一个夜间捕食者。当它被激怒时，它的眼睛会发出鲜红的光芒，当纳加库加移动时，会留下一串红色的线条。纳加库加几乎能用身体的每个部分进行攻击，主要是它的带刃的翅膀和带刺的尾巴。它的尾巴上竖立着大的尖刺，可以甩动并与它的攻击连在一起，进行毁灭性的打击。它们的脊椎骨和尾巴上的肌肉非常灵活，使纳加库加的尾巴也具有伸缩性。它的尾巴也是它最强大的武器。尾巴末端的鳞片也可以被摇动，产生类似于响尾蛇的响声。
纳加库加是一个小心谨慎的怪物。它很容易潜入猎人身边。Nargacuga生活在它所适应的黑暗地方。它在难以到达的高树上休息，或者也许无法到达，所以猎人无法出其不意地捕捉它。由于Nargacuga的自然感觉，当猎人就在树前时，它就会醒过来。
Nargacuga通常主要存在于大森林中。虽然偶尔也能在沼泽地、丛林中发现纳加库加，但很少在山脉或平原上发现。

items.name: Nargacuga Scale
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can take the {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

items.name: Nargacuga Pelt
entries: While you wear this armor, your eye's glow red at night, much like the nargacuga's. You gain {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet. if you already have darkvision, it is increased by an additional 60 feet.

items.name: Nargacuga Razor
entries: While you wear this armor, being in a lightly obscured area doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks if you can both see and hear.

items.name: Narga Medulla
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nargacuga Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, your walking speed becomes 30 feet, unless your walking speed is higher, and your speed isn't reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance, though you can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

items.name: Nargacuga Tailspike
entries: {@i Evade Window.} 这个盔甲有3个符文，每天在黎明时分恢复1d3个已消耗的符文。当你穿着它的时候，你的灵巧救赎失败，你可以用你的反应来消耗它的一个符文来代替救赎成功。

items.name: Nargacuga Scale
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 slashing damage.

items.name: Nargacuga Fang
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, your ammo pouch can hold double the amount of {@item pierce ammo (20)|AGMH|pierce ammo} and {@item cluster ammo (1)|AGMH|cluster ammo} it can normally hold.

items.name: Nargacuga Razor
entries: {@i Abnormal Status Atk up (M).} Whenever you inflict a condition on a creature or object that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, the maximum duration of the condition is increased by 12 seconds.

items.name: Narga Medulla
entries: {@i Quick Load.} You can reload as a free action while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Nargacuga Tail
entries: {@i Status Pursuit+.} You have advantage on opportunity attacks and creatures within your reach provoke opportunity attacks even if they took the {@action Disengage} action, if the creature is afflicted with a Condition.

items.name: Nargacuga Tailspike
entries: {@i Critical Eye.}你的武器攻击关键命中范围增加1。

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nergigante fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nergigante has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spiked Regrowth
entries: The nergigante has spikes covering its body, granting it +2 AC. These spikes regrow at the start of the nergigante's turn if they are lost. After using an action or legendary action, the nergigante can use its spiked explosion as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nergigante can use its frightful presence. It then makes four attacks. one with its bite, one with its horn, and two with its claws.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the nergigante's choice that is within 120 feet of the nergigante and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nergigante's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Meteor Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: The nergigante leaps into the air using its wings to hover briefly and comes crashing down in a 15-foot square area within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 59 ({@damage 17d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spiked Explosion
entries: The spikes on the nergigante explode outward, removing the AC bonus it receives spiked regrowth and strikes all targets within 30-foot sphere of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Dragon Eater
entries: The nergigante feeds on the corpse of a dragon. A large or smaller dragon is consumed whole, while the nergigante can feed on a Huge or bigger dragon for up to 30 seconds. For each round the Nergigante feeds on a dragon, it heals for an amount equal to the dragons Challenge rating.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: The nergigante makes a wing attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the nergigante moves through must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Like most other Elder Dragons, Nergigante possesses six limbs; four legs and two wings. On its head are two large horns resembling a bull. Though it is classified as an Elder Dragon, the Nergigante isn't known to cause any natural disasters, but its sudden appearance is enough to scare off other species, which can cause them to invade other areas.

Covering Nergigante's head, arms, tail, and wings are small spikes that break easily with enough damage. These spikes are believed to be made of a material similar to enamel and can break in a number of ways, though they mostly break from the sheer force of Nergigante's attacks. Unlike other Elder Dragons that use elemental abilities to survive, Nergigante uses brute strength to take on its prey.

Nergigante also has extreme regenerative abilities that allow it to regrow lost spikes, up to 1800 of them, in mere seconds. Researchers theorize that this regenerative process starts when its spikes have taken a certain amount of damage, and it is said that it can regrow them an infinite number of times. It also seems to have the ability to sense highly pure bioenergy.

Nergigante doesn't have a gender and reproduces asexually. It needs large quantities of bioenergy to propagate, but the way it does so is bizarre compared to other species. When Nergigante regenerates its spikes, some of them may gain the bioenergy it has used and begin to produce germ cells, allowing Nergigante to produce another of its kind without the need of a mate. Since Nergigante needs more bioenergy than usual to produce the next generation, it needs to find a food source with incredible strength. Interestingly, the offspring are genetically identical to their parent.

items.name: Nergigante Regrowth Plate
entries: 穿着这件盔甲时，只要你有至少1个命中率，你每10分钟就能恢复1d6个命中率。如果你失去了一个身体部位，如果你在整个过程中至少有1个命中率，该盔甲会使缺少的部位重新生长，并在1d6+1天后恢复全部功能。

items.name: Nergigante Carapace
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+3.}穿戴此盔甲时，你可以使用行动从它身上施放{@spell haste}法术，每天一次，但施放时只能以自己为目标。

items.name: Nergigante Talon
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 2d4} piercing damage to them. This damage bypasses resistance and immunity, and can't be reduced or avoided by any means.

items.name: Nergigante Tail
entries: 穿着这件盔甲时，对你的任何关键打击都会变成普通打击。

items.name: Immortal Dragonscale
entries: You have resistance to fire and cold damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nergigante Gem
entries: While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against you.

items.name: Nergigante Regrowth Plate
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Nergigante Carapace
entries: {@i (Bow only)} As a bonus action you can grow a black spike from the palm of your hand and nock it to your bow. A creature hit by this spike suffers normal weapon damage and the spike lodges itself into the creature. A creature's speed is reduced by 5 feet for every spike impaled into it. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to pull out the spikes, or if some other effect removes them, the creature's movement speed returns to normal.
You are able to grow up to 10 black spikes. You are unable to grow anymore until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nergigante Talon
entries: 你的武器会造成额外的1d10割裂伤害。

items.name: Nergigante Tail
entries: When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage, provided that the target isn't a construct or an Undead. You gain temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

items.name: Immortal Dragonscale
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Nergigante Gem
entries: The first time you attack with this weapon on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your armor class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. For example you could reduce the bonus to your attack and damage rolls by 2 to gain a +2 bonus to AC. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: 任何稀有的武器升级材料。

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: 任何稀有的装甲升级材料。

trait.name: Reel In
entries: As a bonus action, the nerscylla can pull a webbed target up to 15 feet towards it. If the webbed creature is pulled within 5 feet of the nerscylla, it can make a stinger attack against it.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The nerscylla can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The nerscylla's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the nersyclla knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Swing
entries: As a bonus action the nerscylla can fire a string of webbing as thick as a rope towards an object or terrain that is above it and is within 60 feet of it. It can then use the webbing to pull itself up to 30 feet in the direction of the object or terrain.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The nerscylla ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nerscylla makes three attack, one with its poisonous maw and two with its claws.

action.name: Poisonous Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. On hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Stinger
entries: The nerscylla impales a webbed creature within 5 feet of it with its stinger. That creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Webbing Shot {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The creature is no longer {@condition restrained} if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 12, 10 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Nerscylla physically resembles a real life Arachnid, but is much larger in size. Nerscylla is armed with four powerful legs and two claws, each one tipped with a formidable barbed hook, used for holding prey as well as keeping its grip while scaling walls. In addition, it possesses a massive pair of retractable jaws which can inflict a poisonous bite. It can produce a strong, sticky webbing that it uses to trap prey and build nests. Its long, strong legs allow it to move at fast speeds, even sideways. At the tip of its abdomen is a large stinger it may use to attack. Sharp, poisonous spikes protrude from its back.

These large Temnocerans are ambush predators that will readily attack from behind, below, and above. When making a web they'll wisely construct it in an area where potential prey is most likely to appear. They are most commonly seen to construct their webs near farming settlements where they will attack and kill any livestock that wander into the vicinity of their web for food. Occasionally, they will even snatch away any unwary villagers/farmers that wander into their territory. As stated earlier {@creature Gypceros|MHMM} are the favorite prey of the Nerscylla but the food isn't the only reason why the Bird Wyvern is targeted. When killing a Gypceros the large arachnid not only eats it but disturbingly rips the skin off the avian Wyvern's body and wears it's skin as a cloak. This shocking behavior is both horrifying and intriguing to naturalists. The reason why Nerscylla do this is to increase their strength, use as camouflage, and for protection.

items.name: Rubbery Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to lightning damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nerscylla Shell
entries: {@i Perceptive.} You are proficient with {@i Perception} checks while wearing this armor.

items.name: Nerscylla Chelicera
entries: {@i Trap Master.} While you wear this armor, you can set {@item pitfall trap|AGMH}s or {@item shock trap|AGMH}s as a bonus action and you can use an action to cast the {@spell snare|XGE} spell from it. Once used, the snare effect can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: {@i Negate Sleep.} You cannot unwillingly be put to sleep by any means while wearing this armor.

items.name: Nerscylla Claw
entries: {@i Spider Climb.} While you wear this armor, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the armor doesn't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

items.name: Nerscylla Spike
entries: You have resistance to poison damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rubbery Hide
entries: While holding your weapon, you can speak a command word and transform it into a fishing pole with a hook, a line, and a reel. Speaking the command word again changes the fishing pole back into the weapon.

items.name: Nerscylla Chelicera
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon they must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Novice.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: When you {@condition poisoned|PHB|poison} a creature and they fail the saving throw by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until they take damage, are shaken awake, or the poison is removed.

items.name: Nerscylla Claw
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll.

items.name: Nerscylla Spike
entries: When you hit a creature or object that is within 60 feet of you with a ranged weapon attack, you can use your bonus action to pull the target 10 feet towards you.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to charm a creature with spells or spell like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby {@creature seltas|MHMM} while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: 不常见或罕见的升级材料，可用于武器或盔甲。

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo}.

trait.name: Desert Camouflage
entries: The nibelsnarf has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in desert terrain while burrowed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nibelsnarf makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wind Tunnel {@recharge 5}
entries: The nibelsnarf exhales sand and debris swallowed in a 30-foot cone, each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

reaction.name: Sand Cloud
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the nibelsnarf, it can use its reaction to expel a large sand cloud from the gills on the back of its head. Any creature within 5 feet of the nibelsnarf and flanking it must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails the save by more than 5 they are also pushed 10 feet away from the nibelsnarf.

Leviathans that have adapted to live in sandy areas. They burrow through sand and locate prey aurally, then suck both the target and any surrounding sand into their maws. It has the remarkable ability to swim in sand, shared only with a few monsters, and its streamlined body helps it move through it at great speeds. They are capable of burrowing into the sand and of disguising themselves as sand dunes to ambush prey.

It has a huge mouth for eating its prey such as {@creature Rhenoplos|MHMM} in one bite, like the {@creature Gobul|MHMM}. It locates its prey with hearing. It shares this trait with the {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}, which is also a land dwelling Leviathan. It is possible that the two developed this ability because they spend most of their time underground. It spits sand at predators that try to attack it. Its eyes are on top of its head, so it can see its prey easier when lurking in the sand; however, their placement also makes it difficult for it to see anything directly in front of it. They also have salamander-like "gills" which it uses to filter out sand and absorb minerals in the sand. It uses this clearing of the sand as an attack, as the sand shoots from the gills at a high enough speed to hurt individuals caught in the blast. Niblesnarf seem to have very strong stomachs, capable of withstanding a bomb exploding in it. Inside the massive mouth of this predator is an enlarged uvula that stores nutrients. This organ is essential to the leviathan's survival within the arid Sandy Plains.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Hide
entries: {@i Gourmand.} While attuned to this armor, you double the amount of days you can go without food or water before suffering a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: Nibel Carapace
entries: {@i Speed Eating.}当你与此盔甲相适应时，你可以使用任何消耗品，如药水或食物，作为一个额外的动作；只要你是消耗它的人。

items.name: Brilliant Fluid
entries: While you wear this armor, you can use a bonus action to exhale sand and debris in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
一旦使用，这个属性就不能再使用，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Nibelsnarf Scalp
entries: While you wear this armor, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in desert terrain.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Claw
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Pellet Shot.} When you roll a 15 or higher on your attack roll with this weapon while using normal ammo, you can make an attack against an additional creature within 5 feet of your original target.

items.name: Brilliant Fluid
entries: {@i (Druid, Sorcerer, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this weapon you can cast the {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} and the {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} spell at 2nd level once per day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Scalp
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is {@condition blinded} while flying, it immediately falls to the ground and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage or 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage or 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Deep Breath
entries: The paolumu takes a deep breath, pulling all creatures and objects within a 60-foot radius of it 20 feet towards it. An unwilling creature that can see the paolumu can make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is not pulled towards the paolumu. A creature or object behind cover, automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

Additionally, all sleep clouds within range are inhaled by the paolumu. These clouds travel across the ground until directly below the paolumu before vanishing. If a sleep cloud passes through a creatures space, they must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, at disadvantage if more than one cloud passes through their space. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. If they fail the save by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until the creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Dive Bomb
entries: If the paolumu is flying, and dives at least 10 feet straight toward a target it can then use this action to slam its body in a space that contains one or more creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice), or take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the paolumu's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the paolumu's space.

action.name: Sleep Cloud
entries: The paolumu exhales a narcotic gas at a location within 60 feet of it. This pale blue-green gas fills a 5-foot radius sphere centered on that location for 10 minutes or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

A creature that starts its turn in this gas or enters it for the first time on its turn must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. If they fail the save by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until the creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Sleep Gas (1/day)
entries: The paolumu fills its lungs with as much air as possible and releases a torrent of sleep gas in a 30-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. If the creature fails the throw by 5 or more, they fall {@condition unconscious} until someone until the  creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The paolumu makes one attack with its tail.

legendary.name: Breathe
entries: The paolumu moves up to two sleep clouds 10 feet away from it or 10 feet towards it.

legendary.name: Enlarge
entries: For 1 minute or until the paolumu uses its sleep cloud or sleep gas, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Huge, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

legendary.name: Sleep (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The paolumu uses its sleep cloud.

The Nightshade Paolumu body is covered in soft fur that is primarily black or dark purple, contrasting with its standard counterpart's white-and-pink coloration. Its tail is also darkly colored, matching the color of its fur. Its face is pale white, while on its neck are two brightly colored patches resembling the patterns on the tail feathers of a peacock. When it is deflated, these patches are more difficult to see. Its wings contain faint hints of green on the webbing.

Nightshade Paolumu is far more aggressive and proficient in aerial combat than {@creature Paolumu|MHMM}. Whereas Paolumu requires several attempts to suck enough air into its throat sac to get airborne, Nightshade Paolumu is able to inflate itself with a single inhalation. Once airborne, it is capable of flying at high speeds and in unpredictable patterns by releasing its stored air, often dealing damage to hunters that are hit.

Its most distinctive ability is a pale blue-green gas it expels from its mouth while inflated, which acts as a powerful narcotic that puts to sleep hunters that are exposed. It's able to produce small clouds or exhale a single, massive cloud, which remain on the battlefield for a short duration. It can inhale without inflating itself in order to draw in patches of its gas, and it can spread them out using the wind currents it stirs up with its tail.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Thickfur
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can take the {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Shard
entries: 当你穿上这件盔甲时，你对{@skill Acrobatics}检查有+3的奖励。

items.name: Torpor Sac
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition unconscious} condition or other sleep-like effects, you do so with advantage.

items.name: Paolumu Cortex
entries: You have resistance to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Fellwing
entries: {@i Wide-Range.}当你使用{@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}、{@item Antidote|AGMH}s、{@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s、{@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s、{@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}时；你周围10英尺范围内的所有其他生物都会获得其效果。

items.name: Nightshade Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|PHB|enlarge} spell from it. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Thickfur
entries: You can read books you are touching while sleeping.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Shard
entries: 你的武器会造成额外的1d6重击伤害。

items.name: Torpor Sac
entries: {@i {Spellcaster only)} You know the {@spell sleep} spell while you wear this armor. If you prepare spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If this spell is not on your class list, the spell is nonetheless a class spell for you.

items.name: Paolumu Cortex
entries: This weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, it magically awakens you and your companions within a 30-foot range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Fellwing
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} When you have advantage on an attack roll with this weapon and you hit the target, you can have your weapon deal its maximum damage if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target (all extra damage dice must still be rolled). You can use this property a number of times equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nightshade Gem
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The nitrotoad explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and be thrown 10 feet in a random direction away from the nitrotoad on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't thrown on a successful one.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The nitrotoad's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}1次穿刺伤害。

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the odogaron reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the odogaron can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a claw attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The odogaron makes three attacks; one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose 5 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an bloody wound. Each time the odogaron hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@dice 1d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The odogaron halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The odogaron must be able to see the attacker.

Odogaron resembles a gruesome feral dog. It is covered in red scales and bony protrusions that resemble muscle tissue and bone. Its tail is particularly bony and can be used as a club. The monster has piercing blue eyes. Odogaron's most distinctive feature is its double row of claws, which it uses to inflict deep wounds in its prey, causing them to bleed to death.

Despite its size, Odogaron is quite an agile monster. It is able to rush down prey before delivering bites with its powerful jaws. Odogaron makes its home in the Underdark, where it can be seen dragging back the carcasses of its prey. However, it will venture up to the surface above in search of prey, where it assumes an apex role in the food chain alongside {@creature Legiana|MHMM}.

Odogaron is a hostile monster that will attack anything that it encounters on sight, no matter how big a prey item is. This monster is even willing to attack {@creature Vaal Hazak|MHMM} an elder dragon despite essentially confronting a primordial force.

items.name: Odogaron Sinew
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Intimidation} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Odogaron Scale
entries: 当你穿着这件盔甲时，你可以使用你的反应或额外行动来获得对坏死性伤害的抵抗，直到你下一个回合结束。你可以使用这个属性两次，当你完成长时间的休息时可以恢复所有的使用。

items.name: Odogaron Claw
entries: {@i Marathon Sprinter.} While wearing this armor, you can take the {@action dash} action as a bonus action. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Odogaron Plate
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} You are immune to wounding effects, such as the {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s bloody wound or the {@creature bearded devil}'s infernal wound while you wear this armor.

items.name: Odogaron Sinew
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.}当你与此武器相适应时，即使你已经拔出武器作为你动作的一部分，你也可以随时以自由动作将其出鞘。

items.name: Odogaron Claw
entries: 你的武器会造成额外的1d4的砍击伤害。

items.name: Odogaron Tail
entries: {@i (Light Bowgun only)} When you hit a target with your {@item demon ammo (1)|AGMH|demon ammo}, its effect is doubled.

items.name: Odogaron Fang
entries: {@i Critical Eye.}你的武器攻击关键命中范围增加1。

items.name: Odogaron Gem
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success.

items.name: Nourishing Extract
entries: A material that replaces the {@item catalyst|AGMH} for crafting {@item demondrug|AGMH} or {@item armorskin|AGMH} potions. It can also be used in place of {@item mega nutrients|AGMH} when crafting {@item max potion|AGMH}s or {@item ancient potion|AGMH}s.

items.name: Odogaron Scale
entries: A material that when combined with a {@item vial|PHB} creates {@item Oil of Sharpness|DMG} ({@dc 15} {@item Alchemist's Supplies|PHB}).

monster.name: Palamute
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The palamute has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Canine Mount
entries: A Medium or smaller humanoid creature can ride on the palamute's back if it allows it. In such a situation, the palamute acts as a controlled mount. While on it, the rider can use its bonus action to use the palamute's trackers trait.

trait.name: Scent (Recharges on a long rest)
entries: When the palamute finds the sign of a creature, it can spend 1 minute memorizing that creature's scent. For the next 24 hours, the palamute has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track the creature.

trait.name: Tracker
entries: As a bonus action, the palamute can move up to its speed towards the creature it has the scent of, or if it is following its scent trail.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The palamute makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Maul (Recharges on a short or long rest)
entries: The palamute leaps onto a Large or bigger creature's face and makes one bite attack against it. On a hit, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a hit or miss, the palamute remains on the creature and has advantage on melee attack rolls while it remains on it.

At the start of the palamute's turn, it must make an contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against the creature's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. On a failed check, the palamute is thrown off the creature and lands in a space adjacent to it. If the palamute fails the check by 5 or more, it lands {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Palamute Sidekick
entries: As of right now, the palamute stat block has been built with the idea of using it as a sidekick using {@book Tasha's Cauldron for Everything rules (p.142)|tce,4,sidekicks}.

Since many of the rules on armor and weapon proficiencies require the creature to be humanoid. We will instead just ignore that rule and the palamutes gain the same proficiencies as if they were humanoid, except for ranged weapons, palamutes can't use those (thrown weapons are ok).

So what do we do about costs for gear and rarity? Well for the sake of it all until I get around to making proper sidekick classes for palamutes and palicos. You can use the standard {@item barding|PHB} rules found in the DMG for cost of armor (4x normal amount I believe), or allow them to be bought for normal cost since palamutes and palicos are pretty common in monster hunter. It is up to your DM.

Rarity doesn't necessarily matter for this gear as I don't plan on letting the palamutes or palicos gain weapon properties from rarities. Instead I'll eventually make more of their abilities into uses based on armor or weapon rarity I believe.

{@b For now I am considering allowing 1 armor and 1 weapon material allowed in the palamutes and palico's gear}, but this is a test and I am not really sure how good or bad this may be. It is up to your DM if they choose to allow it also.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panics, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Huge, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Huge, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Dive Bomb
entries: If the paolumu is flying, enlarged and dives at least 10 feet straight toward a target it can then use this action to slam its body in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the paolumu's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the paolumu's space.

action.name: Wind Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The paolumu exhales blast of strong wind in a 60 foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) thunder damage and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and not knocked {@condition prone}. The wind tunnel disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

Paolumu is a bat-like wyvern that slightly resembles the Honduran white bat. Like said bat species, Paolumu is covered in white fur and has a pink face. Though it is covered in fur, Paolumu also has some brown scales covering its back, underbelly, and tail. The Paolumu has rodent-like buck teeth this is because its diet consists of the eggs that comes off the coral which it sucks in using its incredible breathing power.

Inside of Paolumu's neck is a special air sac that inflates once it has sucked in enough air. Once its air sac has inflated, Paolumu is able to float in the air like a balloon and able to attack foes from above. While floating, Paolumu will use its hardtail to batter foes at close range. Paolumu is also able to breathe wind at foes, it can also use its inhaling powers to draw in hunters closer or to make them stagger.
Paolumu are fairly calm unless provoked by a threat. Once provoked, they will become aggressive.

items.name: Paolumu Scale
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. You can use this property twice, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Paolumu Shell
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Paolumu Pelt
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+1.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Paolumu Webbing
entries: {@i Windproof.}你所施展的法术，如{@spell fog cloud}，在你穿上此盔甲时，不能再被风、魔法或其他方式所驱散。

items.name: Lumu Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|PHB|enlarge} spell from it. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Paolumu Scale
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Paolumu Shell
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to speak its command word and exhale a blast of strong wind in a 45-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and is not knocked prone.
一旦使用，这个属性就不能再使用，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Paolumu Pelt
entries: While flying, you can take the {@action dodge} action as a bonus action while you hold this weapon.

items.name: Paolumu Webbing
entries: {@i Master Mounter.} You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks when attempting to {@action Climb Onto a Bigger Creature|DMG} (DMG p.271) while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Lumu Gem
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery+.}当与此武器相适应时，你的狼牙棒现在可以在每个长时间的休息中使用两次，并且你可以在你的炮弹攻击的伤害上加上你的力量修正值。

items.name: Nourishing Extract
entries: A material that replaces the {@item catalyst|AGMH} for crafting {@item demondrug|AGMH} or {@item armorskin|AGMH} potions. It can also be used in place of {@item mega nutrients|AGMH} when crafting {@item max potion|AGMH}s or {@item ancient potion|AGMH}s.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panics, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 3d4 + 2}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Medium, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Medium, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Wind Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The paolumu exhales blast of strong wind in a 30 foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and not knocked {@condition prone}. The wind tunnel disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

Paolumu is a bat-like wyvern that slightly resembles the Honduran white bat. Like said bat species, Paolumu is covered in white fur and has a pink face. Though it is covered in fur, Paolumu also has some brown scales covering its back, underbelly, and tail. The Paolumu has rodent-like buck teeth this is because its diet consists of the eggs that comes off the coral which it sucks in using its incredible breathing power.

Inside of Paolumu's neck is a special air sac that inflates once it has sucked in enough air. Once its air sac has inflated, Paolumu is able to float in the air like a balloon and able to attack foes from above. While floating, Paolumu will use its hardtail to batter foes at close range. Paolumu is also able to breathe wind at foes, it can also use its inhaling powers to draw in hunters closer or to make them stagger.
Paolumu are fairly calm unless provoked by a threat. Once provoked, they will become aggressive.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Scale
entries: 当你穿上这件盔甲时，你受到的寒冷伤害减少3。

items.name: Paolumu Pup Shell
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Pelt
entries: While you wear this armor a ruff (also known as a millstone collar) appears as part of your attire. You do not gain any benefit from the ruff, except that it makes you look more regal.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Scale
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to speak its command word and exhale a blast of strong wind in a 45-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and is not knocked prone.
一旦使用，这个属性就不能再使用，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Paolumu Pup Shell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, add 1/2 of your proficiency bonus to that damage.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Pelt
entries: {@i Artillery.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used twice per long rest.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The paratoad explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on a success.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The paratoad's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}1次穿刺伤害。

trait.name: Countershading
entries: While in water, the plesioth can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The plesioth makes two attacks, one Hipcheck attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Hipcheck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4})重击伤害。

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8}击中，到达10英尺，一个目标。{@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4})重击伤害。

action.name: Water Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The plesioth releases a high pressure stream of water in an 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide or across a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage and not on a successful one.

action.name: Slither
entries: The plesioth up to its speed on its belly without provoking attacks of opportunity, during this move it may move through other creatures. Any creatures the plesioth moves through must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Plesioth are bipedal monsters with a wyvern-esque body structure. They have webbed feet and a paddle-like tail, and are covered in shiny, fish-like scales. Their mouth is filled with shark-like teeth, and their eyes glow a bright yellow. Their head and back feature large fins which can fold in and out at will.

Plesioth do not possess gills for breathing underwater, so they have to come up for air every so often to fill their lungs with air. In addition to having lungs these creatures can also breath through their skin like an amphibian or sea snake. The fins of Plesioth allow it to swim fast enough to pass a galloping horse. Covering a Plesioth's body is these shiny black scales used to hold in moisture. A scale from older Plesioth can fend off claw and fang attacks. Plesioth have powerful jaws that can crush the shell of Carapaceon, and other armored species, making preying on those species easier. One of its most well-known features is its ability to breath high-pressurized water at its foes. The water that it uses is swallowed while swimming before Plesioth actually uses it as a weapon.

Plesioth can fire highly pressurized jets of water at foes, and can use their massive size and weight to crush and batter attackers. They are highly adept at swimming and are both agile and deadly in the water. Plesioth are ambush predators, adapted to stalking prey from the water and attacking by surprise. They can occasionally be seen on land. Plesioth are commonly found in large bodies of water in a wide variety of environments, such as the jungle, flooded forests, great lake and the coastal ocean waters.

items.name: Plesioth Scale
entries: {@i Airborne.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Plesioth Fin
entries: {@i Speed Eating.}当你与此盔甲相适应时，你可以使用任何消耗品，如药水或食物，作为一个额外的动作；只要你是消耗它的人。

items.name: Plesioth Webbing
entries: {@i Master Mounter.} You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks when attempting to {@action Climb Onto a Bigger Creature|DMG} (DMG p.271) while you are attuned to this armor.

items.name: Plesioth Head
entries: {@i Survivor.} When an ally, that you can see, is reduced to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to gain +1 AC, +1 damage, and +1 to attack rolls for 1 minute. Once this property has been used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Wyvern Stone
entries: {@i Wide-Range.}当你使用{@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}、{@item Antidote|AGMH}s、{@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s、{@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s、{@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}时；你周围10英尺范围内的所有其他生物都会获得其效果。

items.name: Plesioth Fang
entries: {@i Abnormal Status Atk up (S).}每当你对一个生物或物体施加持续时间为1分钟或以上的条件时，条件的最大持续时间增加6秒。

items.name: Plesioth Fin
entries: {@i FastCharge.} When you roll for initiative, your greatsword, longsword, charge blade, or tonfas gains 1 charge, spirit, or phial charge.

items.name: Plesioth Head
entries: {@i Capturer.} When you capture a creature, you gain one extra material from it.

items.name: Wyvern Stone
entries: {@i Quick Load.} You can reload as a free action while you are attuned to this weapon.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the popo moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the popo can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The popo makes one gore attack and one stomp attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1})穿刺伤害。

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1})重击伤害。

A large grazing herbivore, Popo is somewhat easy prey for anything larger than itself. Its size and tusks only work to deter smaller predators. Popo are very docile creatures and will run when one of their members in a group is under attack or when a threat enters their area. They will also group together when a large monster is near, like the {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM} in more temperate climates.

items.name: Popo Tongue
entries: Can be cooked ({@dc 10}). A creature who consumes the cooked tongue can choose any one language. It can read, write, and speak that language for 1 hour.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: 煮熟后可提供2天的口粮。

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: 不常见的装甲升级材料。

trait.name: Diet
entries: A creature that is {@condition poisoned} by the pukei-pukei suffers from an additional effects based on what its eaten. Roll {@dice 1d4}, the number determines the additional condition of its poison. On a 1, {@condition stunned}; On a 2, {@condition deafened}; On a 3, {@condition paralyzed}; On a 4, {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pukei-pukei makes three attacks: two with its tongue and one with its tail. It can replace any one of these with its poison spit attack.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5}击中，到达5英尺，一个目标。{@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3})重击伤害。

action.name: Poison Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Poison Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The pukei-pukei sprays poisonous gas from its tail in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and are not {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Pukei-Pukei slightly resembles a chameleon, and its eyes are similar to frogs. It has a pair of wings and is covered in green scales that vary in color throughout its body excluding its underbelly. Its underbelly is covered in white osteoderm-like protrusions. Despite being reptilian in nature, Pukei-Pukei has vibrant feathers around its neck and wings.

Pukei-Pukei is known to store the properties of its food within its mouth and tail before combining them with its own poison. By doing so, it can spew poison from its mouth and tail for protection. This poison varies depending on its previous meal.
Pukei-Pukei is known to bully smaller monsters, but will flee from larger ones.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Shell
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Deception} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Scale
entries: {@i Botanist.}当你成功收集一个{@table plants|AGMH|plant}资源时，你会收集2个。

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Quill
entries: 当你穿着这件盔甲时，你可以使用你的反应或额外行动来获得对毒药伤害的抗性，直到你下一个回合结束。一旦你使用这个属性，你就不能再使用它，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition poisoned} condition, you do so with a +2 bonus.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Sac
entries: {@i Item Prolonger.}每当你使用一个有持续时间的消耗品时，其持续时间会额外增加6秒。

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Wing
entries: While wearing this armor, you can conjure 1 of 4 types of nut into the palm of your hand and consume it as an action. Choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. Both you and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects of the nut for 1 minute. Roll a d4 to determine the effect of the nut;

On a 1, {@condition stunned}; On a 2, {@condition deafened}; On a 3, {@condition paralyzed}; On a 4, {@condition blinded}. Both creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effecting on a success. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Shell
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item herbalism kit|PHB} while attuned to this weapon. If you are already proficient you double your proficiency bonus when using it.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Scale
entries: While touching this weapon, you can use an action to determine which way is north. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Quill
entries: 当你与此武器相适应时，你可以将此武器作为你的施法重点。

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: 当你施展造成毒药伤害的法术时，将你的熟练度加成的1/2加入该伤害。

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Sac
entries: This weapon has 3 runes. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effecting on a success. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Wing
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll or increase its spell save DC by 1.

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: You can make a {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@item Poisoner's Kit|PHB}) check using this material as its ingredient plus two {@item vial|PHB}s. On a success you create two vials of {@item basic poison (vial)|PHB|basic poison} (PHB p. 153). On a fail, the material is destroyed.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: 不常见的装甲升级材料。

trait.name: Glowing Chin
entries: The uragaan's Jack-o'-lantern chin glows from its eyes and mouth, releasing bright light in a 30-foot cone and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Rise Again (1/day)
entries: When the uragaan is reduced to 0 hit points, it resurrects on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties). When it resurrects, the uragaan's hit points are healed to its maximum, its type is changed from wyvern to undead, and it gains the undead fortitude trait.
Presented for reference, the {@creature zombie}'s {@b Undead Fortitude} trait:

{@i If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uragaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks. Or it makes three attacks with its pumpkin toss.

action.name: Jack-o'-lantern Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pumpkin Toss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is covered in pumpkin guts.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The uragaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the Uragaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Emit Flames
entries: (2/per Long rest). The uragaan releases a wave of fire from its underside in a 10-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and catches fire on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and does not catch fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

The pumpkin uragaan possesses a near identical body shape to the normal {@creature uragaan|MHMM}, yet has a different coloration. Its back and belly are a dark purple while the rest of its body is a pumpkin orange. Its chin is no longer plated with a rock-like shell, but instead is covered by a large jack-o'-lantern.

It has been said that on All Hallows' Eve, a pumpkin uragaan appears in a great pumpkin patch on the outskirts of one of the many villages in the old world. By dawn, the village is left burning, broken, and covered in pumpkin; and the pumpkin uragaan vanishes, until the next All Hallows' Eve.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Carapace
entries: {@i Constitution.}当你穿上这件盔甲时，来自减速效果的持续时间，如{@spell slow}咒语或铜龙的呼吸攻击，会减少一半。

items.name: P.Firecell Stone
entries: 当你必须成功地进行救赎或被击倒时（%0%），你这样做有优势。

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scute
entries: {@i Health Boost.}穿戴此盔甲时，你每拥有一个角色等级，你的最大命中率就会增加1。

items.name: Pumpkin Flame Sac
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
一旦使用，这个属性就不能再使用，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Pumpkin.U Marrow
entries: {@i Guts+.}当你的命中率降到0但没有被直接杀死时，你可以降到1个命中率来代替。一旦你使用这个属性，你就不能再使用它，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Pumpkin.U Ruby
entries: {@i Mushroomancer+.} While wearing this armor you can digest {@table mushrooms|AGMH} that would otherwise be inedible and gain their advantageous effects. The more pumpkin uragaan materials equipped in your armor or trinkets, the more mushrooms you can eat.

entries.name: 1 pumpkin uragaan material
items: Blue Mushroom, {@i Restores a 1d4 hit points.}
Toadstool, {@i You regain 1 hit points at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute.}

entries.name: 2 pumpkin uragaan material
items: 硝化甘油, {@i Your Strength score increases by +2 for 1 minute.}
Parashroom, {@i Your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.}

entries.name: 3 pumpkin uragaan material
items: 混沌蘑菇，{@i You are {@condition poisoned}，持续1小时，并在接下来的10分钟内，每个角色等级获得5个临时打击点数。｝
彬彬有礼, {@i Your speed increases by 15 feet for 1 hour.}

items.name: Pumpkin.U Carapace
entries: This weapon acts as a focus for your spellcasting.

items.name: P.Firecell Stone
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scale
entries: {@i Pumpkin Carver.} While you are attuned to this armor, you can carve a creature of CR 8 or lower 1 extra time.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scute
entries: {@i Partbreaker+1.} You deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage when you critically hit with this weapon.

items.name: Pumpkin Flame Sac
entries: This weapon has 4 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell flaming sphere} spell (save DC 13) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend. A flaming sphere takes the form of a flaming jack-o'-lantern when cast in this way.
This weapon regains 1d4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the weapon's last rune, roll a d20. On a 1, the runes cannot recharge for a week.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Jaw
entries: {@i Resentment.}直到你的回合结束，你对任何在你上一回合结束后伤害过你的生物的攻击和伤害卷获得+1的加成。

trait.name: Sensitive Ears
entries: If the qurupeco takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The qurupeco makes three attacks: one with its flint and two with its peck.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flint
entries: If the qurupeco jumps at least 5 feet towards a creature as part of its movement, it can then use this action to strike its flint-like wingtips together, creating a small explosion in that creatures space. That creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage on failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Call for Aid (1/day)
entries: The qurupeco calls out for assistance, roll a {@dice d6}; If 1 or 2, {@dice 1d4} {@creature Jaggi|MHMM} appear; if 3 or 4, a {@creature Great Jaggi|MHMM} appears; if 5 or 6 a {@creature Royal Ludroth|MHMM} appears.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The qurupeco's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: The Qurupeco resembles a large bird with Pterosaur-like features, such as a fanged beak and leathery wings. It is mainly green colored with some scales being tinted yellow, it also has a clump of iridescent purple feathers on its back between its shoulders. The Qurupeco has a short, stubby brown crest extending from the back of its head. It uses its masterful vocal mimicry abilities to call for aid from various monsters, as well as healing them and boosting their abilities. The Qurupeco's soft crest stretches over the top of its head and when calling opens out into the shape of a megaphone, amplifying its calls. Its most notable feature however is its bright red vocal sac which inflates when calling.

The Qurupeco also has a pair of thick, bulky growths on its wings which produce sparks when struck against each other, much like flints. It uses these to ignite its mucus, causing fiery explosions. Its tail is shaped like a fan and can unfold revealing brightly colored skin, most likely as a warning for any would-be attacker. The Qurupeco's feet seem to have only 3 frontal digits on each foot. It may also have a back digit, but its stubby appearance makes it looks more like a heel. Its feet are also partially webbed.

items.name: Qurupeco Scale
entries: 当你穿着这件盔甲时，你可以使用你的反应或额外行动来获得对火焰伤害的抗性，直到你下一个回合结束。一旦你使用这个属性，你就不能再使用它，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

items.name: Qurupeco Feather
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest you may attempt a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check using an {@filter instrument|items|type=instrument} you are proficient with. On a success, you gain inspiration if you do not already have it.

items.name: Vivid Feather
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Performance} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Alluring Beak
entries: {@i Recovery Speed.}每当你掷出一个命中率骰子来恢复命中率时，它所恢复的命中率数量加倍。

items.name: Flintstone
entries: Your armor is decorated with bird carvings. It has 10 runes. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 rune from the armor and cause it to create one of the following sounds out to a range of 60 feet: a finch's chirp, a raven's caw, a duck's quack, a chicken's cluck, a goose's honk, a loon's call, a turkey's gobble, a seagull's cry, an owl's hoot, or an eagle's shriek.
This armor regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune, roll a d20. On a 1, the runes cannot recharge for a week

items.name: Qurupeco Scale
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item horn|PHB} musical instruments. If you are already proficient, you double your proficiency bonus when using it.

items.name: Qurupeco Feather
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to summon a {@creature jaggi|MHMM} to your aid for 1 hour. It will act on your turn in the initiative and will flee if you or your allies attempt to harm it. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again for one week.

items.name: Vivid Feather
entries: 当你与此武器相适应时，你可以将此武器作为你的施法重点。

items.name: Alluring Beak
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Flintstone
entries: 当你施放一个造成火焰伤害的法术时，你会在其法术攻击卷上获得+1的奖励。

items.name: Screamer Sac
entries: A crafting material used to make {@item sonic bomb|AGMH}s.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: 稀有的盔甲升级材料。

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Web (2/long rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rachnoid exhales fire in a 15-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc l2} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The infant form of {@creature Rakna-Kadaki|MHMM}. At this stage in their life cycle, they cling to their mother's abdomen, feeding on scraps of her regurgitated prey. From birth, they are instantly able to spit webs that are just as strong as their mother's, which they use to bind prey or swiftly move about at her command.

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: While you are grappling a target you can use an action to speak this armor's command word, causing rachnoid silk covering your armor to wrap around the {@condition grappled} target. Until you or the creature takes fire damage, or until it breaks free of your grapple, it has disadvantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Sharp claw
entries: 你的斩击武器会造成额外的1次斩击伤害。

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: Can be used to craft {@item pitfall trap|AGMH} (AGtMH p.63) by combining it with a {@item trap tool|AGMH} using {@item smith's tools|PHB} ({@dc 15}).

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: 不常见或罕见的升级材料，可用于武器或盔甲。

trait.name: Bone Armor
entries: The Radobaan is covered in the bones of fallen creatures granting it +4 AC. When the radobaan takes more than 30 damage in a single turn, the bones snap and break reducing the bonus AC by 1.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The radobaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The radobaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the radobaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 42 ({@damage 12d6}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sleeping Gas (2/Day)
entries: The radobaan releases sleeping gas from its underside. All creatures within 15 ft. must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or, they fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Radobaan looks very similar to {@creature Uragaan|MHMM} in many aspects but has its own unique features. Unlike Uragaan, Radobaan is covered in a tar-like substance that sticks rows of bones onto its body. These bones vary in size throughout the Radobaan's body but the most distinctive ones are on its legs. The bones on its legs are the horns of {@creature Diablos|MHMM}. Though the bones aren't as strong as ore, they are lighter. This lighter weight makes Radobaan faster than Uragaan. Despite not eating ore, Radobaan still has a massive chin like Uragaan. Like Uragaan, Radobaan can roll into a wheel and run over enemies.

It also can emit coma-inducing gas from its body like Uragaan. Radobaan can be fairly calm unless provoked by a threat unlike their ore eating relatives the Uraagan which will become hostile regardless of being threatened or not. Once provoked, they will turn violent.

items.name: Radobaan Shell
entries: {@i Guard.}当你穿上这个盔甲时，你不能被推倒或撞倒。

items.name: Radobaan Scale
entries: 当你穿上这件盔甲时，你对火灾伤害有抵抗力。

items.name: Radobaan Oilshell
entries: {@i Tremor-Proof.} You cannot be knocked {@condition prone} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Radobaan Marrow
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} You are immune to wounding effects, such as the {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s bloody wound or the {@creature bearded devil}'s infernal wound while you wear this armor.

items.name: Radobaan Gem
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that hits you with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural melee weapon takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: This weapon has 4 runes. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or it falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until the sleeper takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo}. (100 uses).

trait.name: Detonate
entries: At the start of the brachydios' turn, the slime explodes. Each creature in the slimes area, takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
